subtitle: These tasty escalopes are simple to prepare and are ideal for preparing in advance and freezing.

method.text: Place each of the escalopes between 2 sheets of greaseproof paper. Flatten slightly with a meat mallet or rolling pin until thin and even.
Dip each escalope into the beaten egg and shake off any excess. Mix the breadcrumbs, herbs and seasoning together then use to coat each escalope.
Heat enough oil in a frying pan to cover the base. Add the escalopes and fry gently for 3-5 min on each side until crisp and golden brown.
Meanwhile, heat the butter and oil together in a pan. Toss the sliced apples in the lemon juice. Add the apple slices to the pan with the onion.
Fry together for 3-5 min or until softened. Pour in the cider and stock. Bring to the boil and then simmer.
Mix the arrowroot with enough cold water to form a smooth paste. Add to the pan with the nuts. Simmer gently for 2-3 min until thickened slightly and heated through.
Drain the escalopes on kitchen paper. Arrange on a large, warmed serving dish. Pour over the sauce and serve.

title: Herby coated pork with apple
